title: Exploring Postmodernism-Based Instructional Design: Simulation/VR Approaches for Secondary Social Studies Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic social structures and possession of digital literacy skills
context.additional_context: A teacher-linked program conducted by a graduate school-affiliated secondary education research center, focusing on building a multi-party collaborative learning environment using VR equipment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply and explain postmodernism’s core concepts (decentralization, respect for diversity) to instructional design models
Learners can design social problem-solving scenarios reflecting multiple interpretive perspectives in VR simulation environments
Learners can provide specific feedback on peers’ postmodern instructional design artifacts using formative assessment tools
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
